Module compare¶

Compatibility: python 3.X

class compare.Handler(refPathScan, compPathScan)¶

Handler class the carries out the comparison between the directories of the libraries

Parameters:
  • refPathScan (ptree.PathScan) – Scan of the reference directory
  • compPathScan (ptree.PathScan) – Scan of the directory to be compared to the reference
compPathScan¶
Returns:Scan of the directory to be compared to the reference
Return type:ptree.PathScan
describe(filepath='./whamdil.log')¶

Create a log file providing a description of differences between the content of directories

Parameters:filepath (str) – Path to the logfile (default=``./whamdil.log``)
misnaming¶
Returns:Collection of Misnaming objects created during the construction
Rtypes:compare.Misnaming

Returns:Scan of the reference directory
Return type:ptree.PathScan
shell(filepath='./whamdil.sh')¶

Create a Bourne shell script file providing commands intending to even the directories

Parameters:filepath (str) – Path to the shell script (default=``./whamdil.sh``)
class compare.Misnaming(path, refName, compName)¶

Represents a file in the compared directory that has the proper relative path but is misnamed.

Parameters:
  • path (str) – relative path of the files
  • refName (str) – name of the file in the reference directory
  • compName (str) – name of the minsnamed file in the compared directory
action(form='text')¶

Produce a text logfile with a description of the action to perform in order to make both paths even

Returns:content of the file
Return type:list(str)
shell()¶

Produce the shell script content

Returns:content of the file
Return type:list(str)
class compare.Misplacement(refPath, refName, compFounds)¶

Represents a file in the compared directory that is placed in a different path from an identical file found in the reference directory. refPath,refName,compFounds

Parameters:
  • refPath – relative path of the reference file
  • refName (str) – name of the file in the reference directory
  • compFounds (list( (str,str) )) – files in the compared directory that are misplaced [(path,filename),...]
action(form='text')¶

Produce a text logfile with a description of the action to perform in order to make both paths even

Returns:content of the file
Return type:list(str)
shell()¶

Produce the shell script content

Returns:content of the file
Return type:list(str)
class compare.Missing(refPath, refName)¶

Descriptive elements for files of the reference directory that are missing in the compared one.

Parameters:
  • refPath (str) – relative path in the reference directory
  • refName (str) – name of the missing file
action(form='text')¶

Produce a text logfile with a description of the action to perform in order to make both paths even

Returns:content of the file
Return type:list(str)
shell()¶

Produce the shell script content

Returns:content of the file
Return type:list(str)
class compare.New(compPath, compName)¶

Descriptive elements for files of the compared directory that are missing in the reference one

Parameters:
  • compPath (str) – relative path in the compared directory
  • compName (str) – name of the new file
action(form='text')¶

Produce a text logfile with a description of the action to perform in order to make both paths even

Returns:content of the file
Return type:list(str)
shell()¶

Produce the shell script content

Returns:content of the file
Return type:list(str)
class compare.Redundancy(hashVal, files)¶

Descriptive elements for files that are redundant in the reference directory

Parameters:
  • hashVal (str) – MD5 hash number of the redundant files (lower case hexadecimal)
  • files (list( (str,str) )) – Collection of information on the redundant files [(path,filename),...]
_Redundancy__fp(path)¶

Format Path for dealing with root directory case
